reviews.text: Rather average sort of junction like station with step free access to the platforms via lifts and only basis seating and shelter is available down on the platform. At least the trains are frequent.

One of my favourite London Overground stations, though it was a bit confusing the first time I used it. Also, more gates are required. There are only two gates, which creates long queues at peak times. The infrastructure is... interesting. Marvel at how what looks like a temporary structure still stands after over ten years. Four stars because it’s a London Overground station and so services get cancelled willy-nilly.

Everytime i’m on the train going from stratford to canonbury and arrive on platform 3 i will miss the train directly adjacent to it on platform 2 for the train going to crystal palace. As soon as my doors open the other train doors close. Theres something they can do with the timing of the train or the train driver could just wait 1 more minute. The next train after that is 8 mins, waiting in the freezing cold in the early hours with other people who were on the same train as me that wanted to catch that same train

You can get practically anywhere in London from this station
Staff are very helpful and the station is kept really clean. Thanks TFL
